history.content:
The seats reserved for EECS juniors in 16B have been filled so you would need students in that category to drop in order for you to be enrolled, as long as your secondary sections are not full. Once the Adjustment Period ends, all unused reserved seats will be released and the waitlist will be processed in order. We set aside some seats for EECS juniors, but not many as it's the faculty's hope that you have already taken this class by your junior year.

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/eecs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy

children.subject: I'm sorry that this is whole transition of 20/40 to 16AB has been so frustrating, however getting your preferred secondary sections is never a guarantee with any of our classes. The waitlist of this class is pretty low at this point and the reserved seats are likely not to fill. Remember that you may attend any discussion section; it does not necessarily have to be the one in which you enroll. You may need to be more flexible with the lab, but with normal attrition, it's even possible you could switch lab sections.

So what I am hearing is that despite using phase 1 units on this class, I am unlikely to get the sections that I want since I will not be processed into the class until the adjustment period? This seems extremely unfair, both given that I need this class to graduate, and also given that as a junior this year, I am part of the transition class from 20/40 to 16A/16B that wasn't given many options in when we take those classes.

history.content: I am an EECS Junior who was put on the wait list when enrolling in EE16B, it has been a week since I enrolled and I have not been removed from the wait list. Will this issue be resolved soon?
history.subject: Enrolling in EE16B
